com.here.msdkui.routing

Class TransportModePanelAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.view.PagerAdapter
      • android.support.v4.app.FragmentStatePagerAdapter
        • com.here.msdkui.routing.TransportModePanelAdapter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleTransportModePanelAdapter

    public abstract class TransportModePanelAdapter
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentStatePagerAdapter
    An adapter class that can be used for a TransportModePanel. You can override this class to customize the panel.
    See Also:
    SimpleTransportModePanelAdapter

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransportModePanelAdapter

        public TransportModePanelAdapter(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager manager)
        Constructs a new instance using a FragmentManager.

        Please set the transport modes list by calling setTransportModes(List) and update the UI by calling PagerAdapter.notifyDataSetChanged().

        Parameters:
        manager - the required FragmentManager.

      • TransportModePanelAdapter

        public TransportModePanelAdapter(android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager manager,
                                 java.util.List<com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode> transportModes)
        Constructs a new instance using a FragmentManager and a list of RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Parameters:
        manager - the required FragmentManager.
        transportModes - the list to use for this adapter.

      • getTabView

        public TabView getTabView(int position)
        Gets the custom TabView at a given position, which represents a RouteOptions.TransportMode. This method can be used to update TabLayout.Tab with the returned custom TabView.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to get the TabView from.
        Returns:
        the custom TabView.

        public java.util.List<com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode> getTransportModes()
        Gets all elements of RouteOptions.TransportMode associated with this adapter.
        Returns:
        the associated transport modes.

      • setTransportModes

        public void setTransportModes(java.util.List<com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode> transportModes)
        Sets a list containing elements of RouteOptions.TransportMode that should be associated with this adapter.
        Parameters:
        transportModes - the list of transport modes.

      • getContent

        public abstract android.support.v4.app.Fragment getContent(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode mode)
        Gets the fragment of TransportModePanel.

        If you don't want to display the content and only want to have a TabView in TransportModePanel, please return null and return false from isContentVisible() method.

        Parameters:
        mode - the RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Returns:
        the fragment of the panel hosting the content.

      • getTabCustomView

        @Deprecated
public abstract TabView getTabCustomView(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode mode)
        Deprecated. Please use getCustomTabView(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode) instead.
        Gets the TabView view for the given RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Returns:
        the TabView that is used to represent the given transport mode.

      • getCustomTabView

        public abstract TabView getCustomTabView(com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions.TransportMode mode)
        Gets the TabView view for the given RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the RouteOptions.TransportMode.
        Returns:
        the TabView that is used to represent the given transport mode.

      • isContentVisible

        public abstract boolean isContentVisible()
        Indicates whether the content is visible. This is responsible for showing the fragment hosting the content for a RouteOptions.TransportMode in the TransportModePanel. If the method returns false, the method getItem(int) will be ignored.
        Returns:
        true if content should be visible, false will hide the content.
